items.title:
Service Design Singapore meetup: Running Design Sprints In Organizations
April 26, 7pm.

object.content:
Service Design Singapore meetup: Running Design Sprints In Organizations
April 26, 7pm.

attachments.content: Design, prototype and test a solution in just 5 days - that's the idea behind the Design Sprint. This process is getting a lot of attention lately, and books have even been written about it. But not everyone is on board; some have even likened it to "snake oil".  What are Design Sprints? What problem are they trying to solve? How do you run a successful sprint? And what are the pitfalls to avoid? In this meetup, Simon will share what he has learn...

items.title:
New Content Strategy Singapore meetup:
Defining Content Workflows
Join us on April 27, 7pm.

object.content:
New Content Strategy Singapore meetup:
Defining Content Workflows
Join us on April 27, 7pm.

attachments.content: A content workflow establishes the process for requesting, creating, reviewing and publishing specific types of content. It is the key to sustaining your content strategy. Without it, we soon descend into content chaos – reactive publishing, late delivery, endless review cycles and broken user experiences. How do we steer content through the multiple people and systems involved? And how do we ensure that what we publish is timely, useful, clear, ...

items.title: Using Lego models in user research - a case study via @PebbleRoadhq

object.content: Using Lego models in user research - a case study  via @PebbleRoadhq

attachments.displayName: Using Lego models in user research - a case study - PebbleRoad
attachments.content: We know that playing with Lego bricks can unleash creativity. But can it also help officers look for ways to solve thorny issues at their service centre? We had an opportunity to find out.
